text: And it came to pass after the death of Joshua, that the children of Israel asked of Jehovah, saying, Who shall go up for us first against the Canaanites, to fight against them?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah said, Judah shall go up: behold, I have delivered the land into his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah said unto Simeon his brother, Come up with me into my lot, that we may fight against the Canaanites; and I likewise will go with thee into thy lot. So Simeon went with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah went up; and Jehovah delivered the Canaanites and the Perizzites into their hand: and they smote of them in Bezek ten thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they found Adoni-bezek in Bezek; and they fought against him, and they smote the Canaanites and the Perizzites.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Adoni-bezek fled; and they pursued after him, and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adoni-bezek said, Threescore and ten kings, having their thumbs and their great toes cut off, gathered their food under my table: as I have done, so God hath requited me. And they brought him to Jerusalem, and he died there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Judah fought against Jerusalem, and took it, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and set the city on fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward the children of Judah went down to fight against the Canaanites that dwelt in the hill-country, and in the South, and in the lowland.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah went against the Canaanites that dwelt in Hebron (now the name of Hebron beforetime was Kiriath-arba); and they smote Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from thence he went against the inhabitants of Debir. (Now the name of Debir beforetime was Kiriath-sepher.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Caleb said, He that smiteth Kiriath-sepher, and taketh it, to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when she came unto him, that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she alighted from off her ass; and Caleb said unto her, What wouldest thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said unto him, Give me a blessing; for that thou hast set me in the land of the South, give me also springs of water. And Caleb gave her the upper springs and the nether springs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of the Kenite, Moses’ brother-in-law, went up out of the city of palm-trees with the children of Judah into the wilderness of Judah, which is in the south of Arad; and they went and dwelt with the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah went with Simeon his brother, and they smote the Canaanites that inhabited Zephath, and utterly destroyed it. And the name of the city was called Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Judah took Gaza with the border thereof, and Ashkelon with the border thereof, and Ekron with the border thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah was with Judah; and drove out the inhabitants of the hill-country; for he could not drive out the inhabitants of the valley, because they had chariots of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave Hebron unto Caleb, as Moses had spoken: and he drove out thence the three sons of Anak.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites that inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house of Joseph, they also went up against Beth-el; and Jehovah was with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the house of Joseph sent to spy out Beth-el. (Now the name of the city beforetime was Luz.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And the watchers saw a man come forth out of the city, and they said unto him, Show us, we pray thee, the entrance into the city, and we will deal kindly with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he showed them the entrance into the city; and they smote the city with the edge of the sword; but they let the man go and all his family.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the man went into the land of the Hittites, and built a city, and called the name thereof Luz, which is the name thereof unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Manasseh did not drive out the inhabitants of Beth-shean and its towns, nor of Taanach and its towns, nor the inhabitants of Dor and its towns, nor the inhabitants of Ibleam and its towns, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo and its towns; but the Canaanites would dwell in that land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when Israel was waxed strong, that they put the Canaanites to taskwork, and did not utterly drive them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ephraim drove not out the Canaanites that dwelt in Gezer; but the Canaanites dwelt in Gezer among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zebulun drove not out the inhabitants of Kitron, nor the inhabitants of Nahalol; but the Canaanites dwelt among them, and became subject to taskwork.
speaker: Narrator

text: Asher drove not out the inhabitants of Acco, nor the inhabitants of Sidon, nor of Ahlab, nor of Achzib, nor of Helbah, nor of Aphik, nor of Rehob;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the Asherites dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land; for they did not drive them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Naphtali drove not out the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh, nor the inhabitants of Beth-anath; but he dwelt among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land: nevertheless the inhabitants of Beth-shemesh and of Beth-anath became subject to taskwork.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Amorites forced the children of Dan into the hill-country; for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley;
speaker: Narrator

text: but the Amorites would dwell in mount Heres, in Aijalon, and in Shaalbim: yet the hand of the house of Joseph prevailed, so that they became subject to taskwork.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border of the Amorites was from the ascent of Akrabbim, from the rock, and upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of Jehovah came up from Gilgal to Bochim. And he said, I made you to go up out of Egypt, and have brought you unto the land which I sware unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break my covenant with you:
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye shall make no covenant with the inhabitants of this land; ye shall break down their altars. But ye have not hearkened unto my voice: why have ye done this?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be as thorns in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when the angel of Jehovah spake these words unto all the children of Israel, that the people lifted up their voice, and wept.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed there unto Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Joshua had sent the people away, the children of Israel went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people served Jehovah all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the elders that outlived Joshua, who had seen all the great work of Jehovah that he had wrought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Jehovah, died, being a hundred and ten years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath-heres, in the hill-country of Ephraim, on the north of the mountain of Gaash.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, that knew not Jehovah, nor yet the work which he had wrought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and served the Baalim;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they forsook Jehovah, the God of their fathers, who brought them out of the land of Egypt, and followed other gods, of the gods of the peoples that were round about them, and bowed themselves down unto them: and they provoked Jehovah to anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they forsook Jehovah, and served Baal and the Ashtaroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel, and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that despoiled them; and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whithersoever they went out, the hand of Jehovah was against them for evil, as Jehovah had spoken, and as Jehovah had sworn unto them: and they were sore distressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah raised up judges, who saved them out of the hand of those that despoiled them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet they hearkened not unto their judges; for they played the harlot after other gods, and bowed themselves down unto them: they turned aside quickly out of the way wherein their fathers walked, obeying the commandments of Jehovah; but they did not so.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jehovah raised them up judges, then Jehovah was with the judge, and saved them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it repented Jehovah because of their groaning by reason of them that oppressed them and vexed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it came to pass, when the judge was dead, that they turned back, and dealt more corruptly than their fathers, in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down unto them; they ceased not from their doings, nor from their stubborn way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel; and he said, Because this nation have transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not hearkened unto my voice;
speaker: Narrator

text: I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them of the nations that Joshua left when he died;
speaker: Narrator

text: that by them I may prove Israel, whether they will keep the way of Jehovah to walk therein, as their fathers did keep it, or not.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jehovah left those nations, without driving them out hastily; neither delivered he them into the hand of Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the nations which Jehovah left, to prove Israel by them, even as many of Israel as had not known all the wars of Canaan;
speaker: Narrator

text: only that the generations of the children of Israel might know, to teach them war, at the least such as beforetime knew nothing thereof:
speaker: Narrator

text: namely, the five lords of the Philistines, and all the Canaanites, and the Sidonians, and the Hivites that dwelt in mount Lebanon, from mount Baal-hermon unto the entrance of Hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were left, to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of Jehovah, which he commanded their fathers by Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites:
speaker: Narrator

text: and they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their own daughters to their sons and served their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and forgat Jehovah their God, and served the Baalim and the Asheroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Cushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia: and the children of Israel served Cushan-rishathaim eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the children of Israel cried unto Jehovah, Jehovah raised up a saviour to the children of Israel, who saved them, even Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb’s younger brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit of Jehovah came upon him, and he judged Israel; and he went out to war, and Jehovah delivered Cushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand: and his hand prevailed against Cushan-rishathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land had rest forty years. And Othniel the son of Kenaz died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah: and Jehovah strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel, because they had done that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he gathered unto him the children of Ammon and Amalek; and he went and smote Israel, and they possessed the city of palm-trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the children of Israel cried unto Jehovah, Jehovah raised them up a saviour, Ehud the son of Gera, the Benjamite, a man left-handed. And the children of Israel sent tribute by him unto Eglon the king of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ehud made him a sword which had two edges, a cubit in length; and he girded it under his raiment upon his right thigh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he offered the tribute unto Eglon king of Moab: now Eglon was a very fat man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had made an end of offering the tribute, he sent away the people that bare the tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he himself turned back from the quarries that were by Gilgal, and said, I have a secret errand unto thee, O king. And he said, Keep silence. And all that stood by him went out from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ehud came unto him; and he was sitting by himself alone in the cool upper room. And Ehud said, I have a message from God unto thee. And he arose out of his seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the sword from his right thigh, and thrust it into his body:
speaker: Narrator

text: and the haft also went in after the blade; and the fat closed upon the blade, for he drew not the sword out of his body; and it came out behind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Ehud went forth into the porch, and shut the doors of the upper room upon him, and locked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when he was gone out, his servants came; and they saw, and, behold, the doors of the upper room were locked; and they said, Surely he is covering his feet in the upper chamber.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they tarried till they were ashamed; and, behold, he opened not the doors of the upper room: therefore they took the key, and opened them; and, behold, their lord was fallen down dead on the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ehud escaped while they tarried, and passed beyond the quarries, and escaped unto Seirah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when he was come, that he blew a trumpet in the hill-country of Ephraim; and the children of Israel went down with him from the hill-country, and he before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Follow after me; for Jehovah hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. And they went down after him, and took the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites, and suffered not a man to pass over.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they smote of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, every lusty man, and every man of valor; and there escaped not a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel. And the land had rest fourscore years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath, who smote of the Philistines six hundred men with an ox-goad: and he also saved Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, when Ehud was dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, that reigned in Hazor; the captain of whose host was Sisera, who dwelt in Harosheth of the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel cried unto Jehovah: for he had nine hundred chariots of iron; and twenty years he mightily oppressed the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth, she judged Israel at that time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she dwelt under the palm-tree of Deborah between Ramah and Beth-el in the hill-country of Ephraim: and the children of Israel came up to her for judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh-naphtali, and said unto him, Hath not Jehovah, the God of Israel, commanded, saying, Go and draw unto mount Tabor, and take with thee ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun?
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will draw unto thee, to the river Kishon, Sisera, the captain of Jabin’s army, with his chariots and his multitude; and I will deliver him into thy hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Barak said unto her, If thou wilt go with me, then I will go; but if thou wilt not go with me, I will not go.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, I will surely go with thee: notwithstanding, the journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honor; for Jehovah will sell Sisera into the hand of a woman. And Deborah arose, and went with Barak to Kedesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali together to Kedesh; and there went up ten thousand men at his feet: and Deborah went up with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Heber the Kenite had separated himself from the Kenites, even from the children of Hobab the brother-in-law of Moses, and had pitched his tent as far as the oak in Zaanannim, which is by Kedesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they told Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone up to mount Tabor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sisera gathered together all his chariots, even nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people that were with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles, unto the river Kishon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Deborah said unto Barak, Up; for this is the day in which Jehovah hath delivered Sisera into thy hand; is not Jehovah gone out before thee? So Barak went down from mount Tabor, and ten thousand men after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah discomfited Sisera, and all his chariots, and all his host, with the edge of the sword before Barak; and Sisera alighted from his chariot, and fled away on his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Barak pursued after the chariots, and after the host, unto Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the host of Sisera fell by the edge of the sword; there was not a man left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite; for there was peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said unto him, Turn in, my lord, turn in to me; fear not. And he turned in unto her into the tent, and she covered him with a rug.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water to drink; for I am thirsty. And she opened a bottle of milk, and gave him drink, and covered him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto her, Stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any man doth come and inquire of thee, and say, Is there any man here? that thou shalt say, No.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jael Heber’s wife took a tent-pin, and took a hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the pin into his temples, and it pierced through into the ground; for he was in a deep sleep; so he swooned and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And, behold, as Barak pursued Sisera, Jael came out to meet him, and said unto him, Come, and I will show thee the man whom thou seekest. And he came unto her; and, behold, Sisera lay dead, and the tent-pin was in his temples.
speaker: Narrator

text: So God subdued on that day Jabin the king of Canaan before the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hand of the children of Israel prevailed more and more against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For that the leaders took the lead in Israel,
For that the people offered themselves willingly,
Bless ye Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Jehovah, when thou wentest forth out of Seir,
When thou marchedst out of the field of Edom,
The earth trembled, the heavens also dropped,
Yea, the clouds dropped water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains quaked at the presence of Jehovah,
Even yon Sinai at the presence of Jehovah, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath,
In the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied,
And the travellers walked through byways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The rulers ceased in Israel, they ceased,
Until that I Deborah arose,
That I arose a mother in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They chose new gods;
Then was war in the gates:
Was there a shield or spear seen
Among forty thousand in Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is toward the governors of Israel,
That offered themselves willingly among the people:
Bless ye Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tell of it, ye that ride on white asses,
Ye that sit on rich carpets,
And ye that walk by the way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Far from the noise of archers, in the places of drawing water,
There shall they rehearse the righteous acts of Jehovah,
Even the righteous acts of his rule in Israel.
Then the people of Jehovah went down to the gates.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then came down a remnant of the nobles and the people;
Jehovah came down for me against the mighty.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why sattest thou among the sheepfolds,
To hear the pipings for the flocks?
At the watercourses of Reuben
There were great searchings of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gilead abode beyond the Jordan:
And Dan, why did he remain in ships?
Asher sat still at the haven of the sea,
And abode by his creeks.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Zebulun was a people that jeoparded their lives unto the death,
And Naphtali, upon the high places of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings came and fought;
Then fought the kings of Canaan,
In Taanach by the waters of Megiddo:
They took no gain of money.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From heaven fought the stars,
From their courses they fought against Sisera.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The river Kishon swept them away,
That ancient river, the river Kishon.
O my soul, march on with strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then did the horsehoofs stamp
By reason of the prancings, the prancings of their strong ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Curse ye Meroz, said the angel of Jehovah.
Curse ye bitterly the inhabitants thereof,
Because they came not to the help of Jehovah,
To the help of Jehovah against the mighty.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He asked water, and she gave him milk;
She brought him butter in a lordly dish.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Through the window she looked forth, and cried,
The mother of Sisera cried through the lattice,
Why is his chariot so long in coming?
Why tarry the wheels of his chariots?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Her wise ladies answered her,
Yea, she returned answer to herself,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have they not found, have they not divided the spoil?
A damsel, two damsels to every man;
To Sisera a spoil of dyed garments,
A spoil of dyed garments embroidered,
Of dyed garments embroidered on both sides, on the necks of the spoil?
speaker: Narrator

text:
So let all thine enemies perish, O Jehovah:
But let them that love him be as the sun when he goeth forth in his might.
And the land had rest forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah: and Jehovah delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel; and because of Midian the children of Israel made them the dens which are in the mountains, and the caves, and the strongholds.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so it was, when Israel had sown, that the Midianites came up, and the Amalekites, and the children of the east; they came up against them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they encamped against them, and destroyed the increase of the earth, till thou come unto Gaza, and left no sustenance in Israel, neither sheep, nor ox, nor ass.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they came up with their cattle and their tents; they came in as locusts for multitude; both they and their camels were without number: and they came into the land to destroy it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel was brought very low because of Midian; and the children of Israel cried unto Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when the children of Israel cried unto Jehovah because of Midian,
speaker: Narrator

text: that Jehovah sent a prophet unto the children of Israel: and he said unto them, Thus saith Jehovah, the God of Israel, I brought you up from Egypt, and brought you forth out of the house of bondage;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all that oppressed you, and drove them out from before you, and gave you their land;
speaker: Narrator

text: and I said unto you, I am Jehovah your God; ye shall not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell. But ye have not hearkened unto my voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of Jehovah came, and sat under the oak which was in Ophrah, that pertained unto Joash the Abiezrite: and his son Gideon was beating out wheat in the winepress, to hide it from the Midianites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of Jehovah appeared unto him, and said unto him, Jehovah is with thee, thou mighty man of valor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon said unto him, Oh, my lord, if Jehovah is with us, why then is all this befallen us? and where are all his wondrous works which our fathers told us of, saying, Did not Jehovah bring us up from Egypt? but now Jehovah hath cast us off, and delivered us into the hand of Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah looked upon him, and said, Go in this thy might, and save Israel from the hand of Midian: have not I sent thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, Oh, Lord, wherewith shall I save Israel? behold, my family is the poorest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah said unto him, Surely I will be with thee, and thou shalt smite the Midianites as one man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto him, If now I have found favor in thy sight, then show me a sign that it is thou that talkest with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Depart not hence, I pray thee, until I come unto thee, and bring forth my present, and lay it before thee. And he said, I will tarry until thou come again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon went in, and made ready a kid, and unleavened cakes of an ephah of meal: the flesh he put in a basket, and he put the broth in a pot, and brought it out unto him under the oak, and presented it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of God said unto him, Take the flesh and the unleavened cakes, and lay them upon this rock, and pour out the broth. And he did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of Jehovah put forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and there went up fire out of the rock, and consumed the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and the angel of Jehovah departed out of his sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon saw that he was the angel of Jehovah; and Gideon said, Alas, O Lord Jehovah! forasmuch as I have seen the angel of Jehovah face to face.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah said unto him, Peace be unto thee; fear not: thou shalt not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Gideon built an altar there unto Jehovah, and called it Jehovah-shalom: unto this day it is yet in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass the same night, that Jehovah said unto him, Take thy father’s bullock, even the second bullock seven years old, and throw down the altar of Baal that thy father hath, and cut down the Asherah that is by it;
speaker: Narrator

text: and build an altar unto Jehovah thy God upon the top of this stronghold, in the orderly manner, and take the second bullock, and offer a burnt-offering with the wood of the Asherah which thou shalt cut down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Gideon took ten men of his servants, and did as Jehovah had spoken unto him: and it came to pass, because he feared his father’s household and the men of the city, so that he could not do it by day, that he did it by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the men of the city arose early in the morning, behold, the altar of Baal was broken down, and the Asherah was cut down that was by it, and the second bullock was offered upon the altar that was built.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said one to another, Who hath done this thing? And when they inquired and asked, they said, Gideon the son of Joash hath done this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of the city said unto Joash, Bring out thy son, that he may die, because he hath broken down the altar of Baal, and because he hath cut down the Asherah that was by it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joash said unto all that stood against him, Will ye contend for Baal? or will ye save him? he that will contend for him, let him be put to death whilst it is yet morning: if he be a god, let him contend for himself, because one hath broken down his altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore on that day he called him Jerubbaal, saying, Let Baal contend against him, because he hath broken down his altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the Midianites and the Amalekites and the children of the east assembled themselves together; and they passed over, and encamped in the valley of Jezreel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Spirit of Jehovah came upon Gideon; and he blew a trumpet; and Abiezer was gathered together after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent messengers throughout all Manasseh; and they also were gathered together after him: and he sent messengers unto Asher, and unto Zebulun, and unto Naphtali; and they came up to meet them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon said unto God, If thou wilt save Israel by my hand, as thou hast spoken,
speaker: Narrator

text: behold, I will put a fleece of wool on the threshing-floor; if there be dew on the fleece only, and it be dry upon all the ground, then shall I know that thou wilt save Israel by my hand, as thou hast spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was so; for he rose up early on the morrow, and pressed the fleece together, and wrung the dew out of the fleece, a bowlful of water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon said unto God, Let not thine anger be kindled against me, and I will speak but this once: let me make trial, I pray thee, but this once with the fleece; let it now be dry only upon the fleece, and upon all the ground let there be dew.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God did so that night: for it was dry upon the fleece only, and there was dew on all the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, and all the people that were with him, rose up early, and encamped beside the spring of Harod: and the camp of Midian was on the north side of them, by the hill of Moreh, in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah said unto Gideon, The people that are with thee are too many for me to give the Midianites into their hand, lest Israel vaunt themselves against me, saying, Mine own hand hath saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore proclaim in the ears of the people, saying, Whosoever is fearful and trembling, let him return and depart from mount Gilead. And there returned of the people twenty and two thousand; and there remained ten thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah said unto Gideon, The people are yet too many; bring them down unto the water, and I will try them for thee there: and it shall be, that of whom I say unto thee, This shall go with thee, the same shall go with thee; and of whomsoever I say unto thee, This shall not go with thee, the same shall not go.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he brought down the people unto the water: and Jehovah said unto Gideon, Every one that lappeth of the water with his tongue, as a dog lappeth, him shalt thou set by himself; likewise every one that boweth down upon his knees to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the number of them that lapped, putting their hand to their mouth, was three hundred men: but all the rest of the people bowed down upon their knees to drink water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah said unto Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thy hand; and let all the people go every man unto his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people took victuals in their hand, and their trumpets; and he sent all the men of Israel every man unto his tent, but retained the three hundred men: and the camp of Midian was beneath him in the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass the same night, that Jehovah said unto him, Arise, get thee down into the camp; for I have delivered it into thy hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if thou fear to go down, go thou with Purah thy servant down to the camp:
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou shalt hear what they say; and afterward shall thy hands be strengthened to go down into the camp. Then went he down with Purah his servant unto the outermost part of the armed men that were in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Midianites and the Amalekites and all the children of the east lay along in the valley like locusts for multitude; and their camels were without number, as the sand which is upon the sea-shore for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Gideon was come, behold, there was a man telling a dream unto his fellow; and he said, Behold, I dreamed a dream; and, lo, a cake of barley bread tumbled into the camp of Midian, and came unto the tent, and smote it so that it fell, and turned it upside down, so that the tent lay flat.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his fellow answered and said, This is nothing else save the sword of Gideon the son of Joash, a man of Israel: into his hand God hath delivered Midian, and all the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was so, when Gideon heard the telling of the dream, and the interpretation thereof, that he worshipped; and he returned into the camp of Israel, and said, Arise; for Jehovah hath delivered into your hand the host of Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put into the hands of all of them trumpets, and empty pitchers, with torches within the pitchers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, Look on me, and do likewise: and, behold, when I come to the outermost part of the camp, it shall be that, as I do, so shall ye do.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I blow the trumpet, I and all that are with me, then blow ye the trumpets also on every side of all the camp, and say, For Jehovah and for Gideon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Gideon, and the hundred men that were with him, came unto the outermost part of the camp in the beginning of the middle watch, when they had but newly set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and brake in pieces the pitchers that were in their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the three companies blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers, and held the torches in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands wherewith to blow; and they cried, The sword of Jehovah and of Gideon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they stood every man in his place round about the camp; and all the host ran; and they shouted, and put them to flight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they blew the three hundred trumpets, and Jehovah set every man’s sword against his fellow, and against all the host; and the host fled as far as Beth-shittah toward Zererah, as far as the border of Abel-meholah, by Tabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Israel were gathered together out of Naphtali, and out of Asher, and out of all Manasseh, and pursued after Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon sent messengers throughout all the hill-country of Ephraim, saying, Come down against Midian, and take before them the waters, as far as Beth-barah, even the Jordan. So all the men of Ephraim were gathered together, and took the waters as far as Beth-barah, even the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took the two princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb; and they slew Oreb at the rock of Oreb, and Zeeb they slew at the winepress of Zeeb, and pursued Midian: and they brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Ephraim said unto him, Why hast thou served us thus, that thou calledst us not, when thou wentest to fight with Midian? And they did chide with him sharply.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto them, What have I now done in comparison with you? Is not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?
speaker: Narrator

text: God hath delivered into your hand the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb: and what was I able to do in comparison with you? Then their anger was abated toward him, when he had said that.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon came to the Jordan, and passed over, he, and the three hundred men that were with him, faint, yet pursuing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto the men of Succoth, Give, I pray you, loaves of bread unto the people that follow me; for they are faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the princes of Succoth said, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thy hand, that we should give bread unto thine army?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon said, Therefore when Jehovah hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went up thence to Penuel, and spake unto them in like manner; and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spake also unto the men of Penuel, saying, When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their hosts with them, about fifteen thousand men, all that were left of all the host of the children of the east; for there fell a hundred and twenty thousand men that drew sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and smote the host; for the host was secure.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zebah and Zalmunna fled; and he pursued after them; and he took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and discomfited all the host.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon the son of Joash returned from the battle from the ascent of Heres.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he caught a young man of the men of Succoth, and inquired of him: and he described for him the princes of Succoth, and the elders thereof, seventy and seven men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came unto the men of Succoth, and said, Behold Zebah and Zalmunna, concerning whom ye did taunt me, saying, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thy hand, that we should give bread unto thy men that are weary?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took the elders of the city, and thorns of the wilderness and briers, and with them he taught the men of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brake down the tower of Penuel, and slew the men of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said he unto Zebah and Zalmunna, What manner of men were they whom ye slew at Tabor? And they answered, As thou art, so were they; each one resembled the children of a king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, They were my brethren, the sons of my mother: as Jehovah liveth, if ye had saved them alive, I would not slay you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said unto Jether his first-born, Up, and slay them. But the youth drew not his sword; for he feared, because he was yet a youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, Rise thou, and fall upon us; for as the man is, so is his strength. And Gideon arose, and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on their camels’ necks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of Israel said unto Gideon, Rule thou over us, both thou, and thy son, and thy son’s son also; for thou hast saved us out of the hand of Midian.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon said unto them, I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you: Jehovah shall rule over you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon said unto them, I would make a request of you, that ye would give me every man the ear-rings of his spoil. (For they had golden ear-rings, because they were Ishmaelites.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered, We will willingly give them. And they spread a garment, and did cast therein every man the ear-rings of his spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the weight of the golden ear-rings that he requested was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold; besides the crescents, and the pendants, and the purple raiment that was on the kings of Midian, and besides the chains that were about their camels’ necks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon made an ephod thereof, and put it in his city, even in Ophrah: and all Israel played the harlot after it there; and it became a snare unto Gideon, and to his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Midian was subdued before the children of Israel, and they lifted up their heads no more. And the land had rest forty years in the days of Gideon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and dwelt in his own house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon had threescore and ten sons of his body begotten; for he had many wives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his concubine that was in Shechem, she also bare him a son, and he called his name Abimelech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the sepulchre of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, as soon as Gideon was dead, that the children of Israel turned again, and played the harlot after the Baalim, and made Baal-berith their god.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel remembered not Jehovah their God, who had delivered them out of the hand of all their enemies on every side;
speaker: Narrator

text: neither showed they kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, according to all the goodness which he had showed unto Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem unto his mother’s brethren, and spake with them, and with all the family of the house of his mother’s father, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak, I pray you, in the ears of all the men of Shechem, Whether is better for you, that all the sons of Jerubbaal, who are threescore and ten persons, rule over you, or that one rule over you? remember also that I am your bone and your flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his mother’s brethren spake of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words: and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said, He is our brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave him threescore and ten pieces of silver out of the house of Baal-berith, wherewith Abimelech hired vain and light fellows, who followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went unto his father’s house at Ophrah, and slew his brethren the sons of Jerubbaal, being threescore and ten persons, upon one stone: but Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left; for he hid himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the men of Shechem assembled themselves together, and all the house of Millo, and went and made Abimelech king, by the oak of the pillar that was in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they told it to Jotham, he went and stood on the top of mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice, and cried, and said unto them, Hearken unto me, ye men of Shechem, that God may hearken unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The trees went forth on a time to anoint a king over them; and they said unto the olive-tree, Reign thou over us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the olive-tree said unto them, Should I leave my fatness, wherewith by me they honor God and man, and go to wave to and fro over the trees?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the trees said to the fig-tree, Come thou, and reign over us.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the fig-tree said unto them, Should I leave my sweetness, and my good fruit, and go to wave to and fro over the trees?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the trees said unto the vine, Come thou, and reign over us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the vine said unto them, Should I leave my new wine, which cheereth God and man, and go to wave to and fro over the trees?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said all the trees unto the bramble, Come thou, and reign over us.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the bramble said unto the trees, If in truth ye anoint me king over you, then come and take refuge in my shade; and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, if ye have dealt truly and uprightly, in that ye have made Abimelech king, and if ye have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done unto him according to the deserving of his hands
speaker: Narrator

text: (for my father fought for you, and adventured his life, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian:
speaker: Narrator

text: and ye are risen up against my father’s house this day, and have slain his sons, threescore and ten persons, upon one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his maid-servant, king over the men of Shechem, because he is your brother);
speaker: Narrator

text: if ye then have dealt truly and uprightly with Jerubbaal and with his house this day, then rejoice ye in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you:
speaker: Narrator

text: but if not, let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the men of Shechem, and the house of Millo; and let fire come out from the men of Shechem, and from the house of Millo, and devour Abimelech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jotham ran away, and fled, and went to Beer, and dwelt there, for fear of Abimelech his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech was prince over Israel three years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the men of Shechem; and the men of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech:
speaker: Narrator

text: that the violence done to the threescore and ten sons of Jerubbaal might come, and that their blood might be laid upon Abimelech their brother, who slew them, and upon the men of Shechem, who strengthened his hands to slay his brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Shechem set liers-in-wait for him on the tops of the mountains, and they robbed all that came along that way by them: and it was told Abimelech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gaal the son of Ebed came with his brethren, and went over to Shechem; and the men of Shechem put their trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went out into the field, and gathered their vineyards, and trod the grapes, and held festival, and went into the house of their god, and did eat and drink, and cursed Abimelech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gaal the son of Ebed said, Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him? is not he the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? serve ye the men of Hamor the father of Shechem: but why should we serve him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And would that this people were under my hand! then would I remove Abimelech. And he said to Abimelech, Increase thine army, and come out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed, his anger was kindled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent messengers unto Abimelech craftily, saying, Behold, Gaal the son of Ebed and his brethren are come to Shechem; and, behold, they constrain the city to take part against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, up by night, thou and the people that are with thee, and lie in wait in the field:
speaker: Narrator

text: and it shall be, that in the morning, as soon as the sun is up, thou shalt rise early, and rush upon the city; and, behold, when he and the people that are with him come out against thee, then mayest thou do to them as thou shalt find occasion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech rose up, and all the people that were with him, by night, and they laid wait against Shechem in four companies.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gaal the son of Ebed went out, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city: and Abimelech rose up, and the people that were with him, from the ambushment.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, Behold, there come people down from the tops of the mountains. And Zebul said unto him, Thou seest the shadow of the mountains as if they were men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gaal spake again and said, See, there come people down by the middle of the land, and one company cometh by the way of the oak of Meonenim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then said Zebul unto him, Where is now thy mouth, that thou saidst, Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him? is not this the people that thou hast despised? go out now, I pray, and fight with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gaal went out before the men of Shechem, and fought with Abimelech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and there fell many wounded, even unto the entrance of the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech dwelt at Arumah: and Zebul drove out Gaal and his brethren, that they should not dwell in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the morrow, that the people went out into the field; and they told Abimelech.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took the people, and divided them into three companies, and laid wait in the field; and he looked, and, behold, the people came forth out of the city; and he rose up against them, and smote them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech, and the companies that were with him, rushed forward, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city: and the two companies rushed upon all that were in the field, and smote them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech fought against the city all that day; and he took the city, and slew the people that were therein: and he beat down the city, and sowed it with salt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the men of the tower of Shechem heard thereof, they entered into the stronghold of the house of Elberith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Abimelech that all the men of the tower of Shechem were gathered together.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech gat him up to mount Zalmon, he and all the people that were with him; and Abimelech took an axe in his hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it up, and laid it on his shoulder: and he said unto the people that were with him, What ye have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people likewise cut down every man his bough, and followed Abimelech, and put them to the stronghold, and set the stronghold on fire upon them; so that all the men of the tower of Shechem died also, about a thousand men and women.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went Abimelech to Thebez, and encamped against Thebez, and took it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there was a strong tower within the city, and thither fled all the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut themselves in, and gat them up to the roof of the tower.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abimelech came unto the tower, and fought against it, and drew near unto the door of the tower to burn it with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a certain woman cast an upper millstone upon Abimelech’s head, and brake his skull.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he called hastily unto the young man his armorbearer, and said unto him, Draw thy sword, and kill me, that men say not of me, A woman slew him. And his young man thrust him through, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they departed every man unto his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus God requited the wickedness of Abimelech, which he did unto his father, in slaying his seventy brethren;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the wickedness of the men of Shechem did God requite upon their heads: and upon them came the curse of Jotham the son of Jerubbaal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after Abimelech there arose to save Israel Tola the son of Puah, the son of Dodo, a man of Issachar; and he dwelt in Shamir in the hill-country of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he judged Israel twenty and three years, and died, and was buried in Shamir.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after him arose Jair, the Gileadite; and he judged Israel twenty and two years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he had thirty sons that rode on thirty ass colts, and they had thirty cities, which are called Havvoth-jair unto this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jair died, and was buried in Kamon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and served the Baalim, and the Ashtaroth, and the gods of Syria, and the gods of Sidon, and the gods of Moab, and the gods of the children of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines; and they forsook Jehovah, and served him not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they vexed and oppressed the children of Israel that year: eighteen years oppressed they all the children of Israel that were beyond the Jordan in the land of the Amorites, which is in Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Ammon passed over the Jordan to fight also against Judah, and against Benjamin, and against the house of Ephraim; so that Israel was sore distressed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel cried unto Jehovah, saying, We have sinned against thee, even because we have forsaken our God, and have served the Baalim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah said unto the children of Israel, Did not I save you from the Egyptians, and from the Amorites, from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Sidonians also, and the Amalekites, and the Maonites, did oppress you; and ye cried unto me, and I saved you out of their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet ye have forsaken me, and served other gods: wherefore I will save you no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go and cry unto the gods which ye have chosen; let them save you in the time of your distress.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel said unto Jehovah, We have sinned: do thou unto us whatsoever seemeth good unto thee; only deliver us, we pray thee, this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they put away the foreign gods from among them, and served Jehovah; and his soul was grieved for the misery of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Ammon were gathered together, and encamped in Gilead. And the children of Israel assembled themselves together, and encamped in Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people, the princes of Gilead, said one to another, What man is he that will begin to fight against the children of Ammon? he shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor, and he was the son of a harlot: and Gilead begat Jephthah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gilead’s wife bare him sons; and when his wife’s sons grew up, they drove out Jephthah, and said unto him, Thou shalt not inherit in our father’s house; for thou art the son of another woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jephthah fled from his brethren, and dwelt in the land of Tob: and there were gathered vain fellows to Jephthah, and they went out with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass after a while, that the children of Ammon made war against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was so, that, when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to fetch Jephthah out of the land of Tob;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they said unto Jephthah, Come and be our chief, that we may fight with the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, Did not ye hate me, and drive me out of my father’s house? and why are ye come unto me now when ye are in distress?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah, Therefore are we turned again to thee now, that thou mayest go with us, and fight with the children of Ammon; and thou shalt be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, If ye bring me home again to fight with the children of Ammon, and Jehovah deliver them before me, shall I be your head?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the elders of Gilead said unto Jephthah, Jehovah shall be witness between us; surely according to thy word so will we do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and chief over them: and Jephthah spake all his words before Jehovah in Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah sent messengers unto the king of the children of Ammon, saying, What hast thou to do with me, that thou art come unto me to fight against my land?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of the children of Ammon answered unto the messengers of Jephthah, Because Israel took away my land, when he came up out of Egypt, from the Arnon even unto the Jabbok, and unto the Jordan: now therefore restore those lands again peaceably.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah sent messengers again unto the king of the children of Ammon;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he said unto him, Thus saith Jephthah: Israel took not away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon;
speaker: Narrator

text: but when they came up from Egypt, and Israel went through the wilderness unto the Red Sea, and came to Kadesh;
speaker: Narrator

text: then Israel sent messengers unto the king of Edom, saying, Let me, I pray thee, pass through thy land; but the king of Edom hearkened not. And in like manner he sent unto the king of Moab; but he would not: and Israel abode in Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went through the wilderness, and went around the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and they encamped on the other side of the Arnon; but they came not within the border of Moab, for the Arnon was the border of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said unto him, Let us pass, we pray thee, through thy land unto my place.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Sihon trusted not Israel to pass through his border; but Sihon gathered all his people together, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehovah, the God of Israel, delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they smote them: so Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they possessed all the border of the Amorites, from the Arnon even unto the Jabbok, and from the wilderness even unto the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now Jehovah, the God of Israel, hath dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel, and shouldest thou possess them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt not thou possess that which Chemosh thy god giveth thee to possess? So whomsoever Jehovah our God hath dispossessed from before us, them will we possess.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now art thou anything better than Balak the son of Zippor, king of Moab? did he ever strive against Israel, or did he ever fight against them?
speaker: Narrator

text: While Israel dwelt in Heshbon and its towns, and in Aroer and its towns, and in all the cities that are along by the side of the Arnon, three hundred years; wherefore did ye not recover them within that time?
speaker: Narrator

text: I therefore have not sinned against thee, but thou doest me wrong to war against me: Jehovah, the Judge, be judge this day between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit the king of the children of Ammon hearkened not unto the words of Jephthah which he sent him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Spirit of Jehovah came upon Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over unto the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah vowed a vow unto Jehovah, and said, If thou wilt indeed deliver the children of Ammon into my hand,
speaker: Narrator

text: then it shall be, that whatsoever cometh forth from the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, it shall be Jehovah’s, and I will offer it up for a burnt-offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jephthah passed over unto the children of Ammon to fight against them; and Jehovah delivered them into his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he smote them from Aroer until thou come to Minnith, even twenty cities, and unto Abel-cheramim, with a very great slaughter. So the children of Ammon were subdued before the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah came to Mizpah unto his house; and, behold, his daughter came out to meet him with timbrels and with dances: and she was his only child; besides her he had neither son nor daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when he saw her, that he rent his clothes, and said, Alas, my daughter! thou hast brought me very low, and thou art one of them that trouble me; for I have opened my mouth unto Jehovah, and I cannot go back.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said unto him, My father, thou hast opened thy mouth unto Jehovah; do unto me according to that which hath proceeded out of thy mouth, forasmuch as Jehovah hath taken vengeance for thee on thine enemies, even on the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said unto her father, Let this thing be done for me: let me alone two months, that I may depart and go down upon the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my companions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Go. And he sent her away for two months: and she departed, she and her companions, and bewailed her virginity upon the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass at the end of two months, that she returned unto her father, who did with her according to his vow which he had vowed: and she knew not man. And it was a custom in Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the daughters of Israel went yearly to celebrate the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Ephraim were gathered together, and passed northward; and they said unto Jephthah, Wherefore passedst thou over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didst not call us to go with thee? we will burn thy house upon thee with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah said unto them, I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, ye saved me not out of their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when I saw that ye saved me not, I put my life in my hand, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and Jehovah delivered them into my hand: wherefore then are ye come up unto me this day, to fight against me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jephthah gathered together all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim; and the men of Gilead smote Ephraim, because they said, Ye are fugitives of Ephraim, ye Gileadites, in the midst of Ephraim, and in the midst of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Gileadites took the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. And it was so, that, when any of the fugitives of Ephraim said, Let me go over, the men of Gilead said unto him, Art thou an Ephraimite? If he said, Nay;
speaker: Narrator

text: then said they unto him, Say now Shibboleth; and he said Sibboleth; for he could not frame to pronounce it right: then they laid hold on him, and slew him at the fords of the Jordan. And there fell at that time of Ephraim forty and two thousand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jephthah judged Israel six years. Then died Jephthah the Gileadite, and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after him Ibzan of Beth-lehem judged Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he had thirty sons; and thirty daughters he sent abroad, and thirty daughters he brought in from abroad for his sons. And he judged Israel seven years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ibzan died, and was buried at Beth-lehem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after him Elon the Zebulunite judged Israel; and he judged Israel ten years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elon the Zebulunite died, and was buried in Aijalon in the land of Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after him Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite judged Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he had forty sons and thirty sons’ sons, that rode on threescore and ten ass colts: and he judged Israel eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite died, and was buried in Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the hill-country of the Amalekites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel again did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah; and Jehovah delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and bare not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of Jehovah appeared unto the woman, and said unto her, Behold now, thou art barren, and bearest not; but thou shalt conceive, and bear a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing:
speaker: Narrator

text: for, lo, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come upon his head; for the child shall be a Nazirite unto God from the womb: and he shall begin to save Israel out of the hand of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, A man of God came unto me, and his countenance was like the countenance of the angel of God, very terrible; and I asked him not whence he was, neither told he me his name:
speaker: Narrator

text: but he said unto me, Behold, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing; for the child shall be a Nazirite unto God from the womb to the day of his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Manoah entreated Jehovah, and said, Oh, Lord, I pray thee, let the man of God whom thou didst send come again unto us, and teach us what we shall do unto the child that shall be born.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God hearkened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again unto the woman as she sat in the field: but Manoah her husband was not with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the woman made haste, and ran, and told her husband, and said unto him, Behold, the man hath appeared unto me, that came unto me the other day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said unto him, Art thou the man that spakest unto the woman? And he said, I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass: what shall be the ordering of the child, and how shall we do unto him?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of Jehovah said unto Manoah, Of all that I said unto the woman let her beware.
speaker: Narrator

text: She may not eat of anything that cometh of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing; all that I commanded her let her observe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Manoah said unto the angel of Jehovah, I pray thee, let us detain thee, that we may make ready a kid for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of Jehovah said unto Manoah, Though thou detain me, I will not eat of thy bread; and if thou wilt make ready a burnt-offering, thou must offer it unto Jehovah. For Manoah knew not that he was the angel of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Manoah said unto the angel of Jehovah, What is thy name, that, when thy words come to pass, we may do thee honor?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of Jehovah said unto him, Wherefore askest thou after my name, seeing it is wonderful?
speaker: Narrator

text: So Manoah took the kid with the meal-offering, and offered it upon the rock unto Jehovah: and the angel did wondrously, and Manoah and his wife looked on.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it came to pass, when the flame went up toward heaven from off the altar, that the angel of Jehovah ascended in the flame of the altar: and Manoah and his wife looked on; and they fell on their faces to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel of Jehovah did no more appear to Manoah or to his wife. Then Manoah knew that he was the angel of Jehovah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Manoah said unto his wife, We shall surely die, because we have seen God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his wife said unto him, If Jehovah were pleased to kill us, he would not have received a burnt-offering and a meal-offering at our hand, neither would he have showed us all these things, nor would at this time have told such things as these.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the woman bare a son, and called his name Samson: and the child grew, and Jehovah blessed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit of Jehovah began to move him in Mahaneh-dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson went down to Timnah, and saw a woman in Timnah of the daughters of the Philistines.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came up, and told his father and his mother, and said, I have seen a woman in Timnah of the daughters of the Philistines: now therefore get her for me to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his father and his mother said unto him, Is there never a woman among the daughters of thy brethren, or among all my people, that thou goest to take a wife of the uncircumcised Philistines? And Samson said unto his father, Get her for me; for she pleaseth me well.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his father and his mother knew not that it was of Jehovah; for he sought an occasion against the Philistines. Now at that time the Philistines had rule over Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then went Samson down, and his father and his mother, to Timnah, and came to the vineyards of Timnah: and, behold, a young lion roared against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit of Jehovah came mightily upon him, and he rent him as he would have rent a kid; and he had nothing in his hand: but he told not his father or his mother what he had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went down, and talked with the woman, and she pleased Samson well.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after a while he returned to take her; and he turned aside to see the carcass of the lion: and, behold, there was a swarm of bees in the body of the lion, and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took it into his hands, and went on, eating as he went; and he came to his father and mother, and gave unto them, and they did eat: but he told them not that he had taken the honey out of the body of the lion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And his father went down unto the woman: and Samson made there a feast; for so used the young men to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when they saw him, that they brought thirty companions to be with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson said unto them, Let me now put forth a riddle unto you: if ye can declare it unto me within the seven days of the feast, and find it out, then I will give you thirty linen garments and thirty changes of raiment;
speaker: Narrator

text: but if ye cannot declare it unto me, then shall ye give me thirty linen garments and thirty changes of raiment. And they said unto him, Put forth thy riddle, that we may hear it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he said unto them,
Out of the eater came forth food,
And out of the strong came forth sweetness.
And they could not in three days declare the riddle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they said unto Samson’s wife, Entice thy husband, that he may declare unto us the riddle, lest we burn thee and thy father’s house with fire: have ye called us to impoverish us? is it not so?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson’s wife wept before him, and said, Thou dost but hate me, and lovest me not: thou hast put forth a riddle unto the children of my people, and hast not told it me. And he said unto her, Behold, I have not told it my father nor my mother, and shall I tell thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And she wept before him the seven days, while their feast lasted: and it came to pass on the seventh day, that he told her, because she pressed him sore; and she told the riddle to the children of her people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the men of the city said unto him on the seventh day before the sun went down, What is sweeter than honey? and what is stronger than a lion? And he said unto them,
If ye had not plowed with my heifer,
Ye had not found out my riddle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Spirit of Jehovah came mightily upon him, and he went down to Ashkelon, and smote thirty men of them, and took their spoil, and gave the changes of raiment unto them that declared the riddle. And his anger was kindled, and he went up to his father’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Samson’s wife was given to his companion, whom he had used as his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it came to pass after a while, in the time of wheat harvest, that Samson visited his wife with a kid; and he said, I will go in to my wife into the chamber. But her father would not suffer him to go in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And her father said, I verily thought that thou hadst utterly hated her; therefore I gave her to thy companion: is not her younger sister fairer than she? take her, I pray thee, instead of her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson said unto them, This time shall I be blameless in regard of the Philistines, when I do them a mischief.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes, and took firebrands, and turned tail to tail, and put a firebrand in the midst between every two tails.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had set the brands on fire, he let them go into the standing grain of the Philistines, and burnt up both the shocks and the standing grain, and also the oliveyards.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Philistines said, Who hath done this? And they said, Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, because he hath taken his wife, and given her to his companion. And the Philistines came up, and burnt her and her father with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson said unto them, If ye do after this manner, surely I will be avenged of you, and after that I will cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he smote them hip and thigh with a great slaughter: and he went down and dwelt in the cleft of the rock of Etam.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Philistines went up, and encamped in Judah, and spread themselves in Lehi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Judah said, Why are ye come up against us? And they said, To bind Samson are we come up, to do to him as he hath done to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then three thousand men of Judah went down to the cleft of the rock of Etam, and said to Samson, Knowest thou not that the Philistines are rulers over us? what then is this that thou hast done unto us? And he said unto them, As they did unto me, so have I done unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto him, We are come down to bind thee, that we may deliver thee into the hand of the Philistines. And Samson said unto them, Swear unto me, that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they spake unto him, saying, No; but we will bind thee fast, and deliver thee into their hand: but surely we will not kill thee. And they bound him with two new ropes, and brought him up from the rock.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came unto Lehi, the Philistines shouted as they met him: and the Spirit of Jehovah came mightily upon him, and the ropes that were upon his arms became as flax that was burnt with fire, and his bands dropped from off his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he found a fresh jawbone of an ass, and put forth his hand, and took it, and smote a thousand men therewith.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Samson said,
With the jawbone of an ass, heaps upon heaps,
With the jawbone of an ass have I smitten a thousand men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking, that he cast away the jawbone out of his hand; and that place was called Ramath-lehi.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was sore athirst, and called on Jehovah, and said, Thou hast given this great deliverance by the hand of thy servant; and now shall I die for thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God clave the hollow place that is in Lehi, and there came water thereout; and when he had drunk, his spirit came again, and he revived: wherefore the name thereof was called En-hakkore, which is in Lehi, unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he judged Israel in the days of the Philistines twenty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a harlot, and went in unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told the Gazites, saying, Samson is come hither. And they compassed him in, and laid wait for him all night in the gate of the city, and were quiet all the night, saying, Let be till morning light, then we will kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Samson lay till midnight, and arose at midnight, and laid hold of the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and plucked them up, bar and all, and put them upon his shoulders, and carried them up to the top of the mountain that is before Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lords of the Philistines came up unto her, and said unto her, Entice him, and see wherein his great strength lieth, and by what means we may prevail against him, that we may bind him to afflict him: and we will give thee every one of us eleven hundred pieces of silver.
speaker: Narrator
